page.title: 09TRANSPORT
page.content: There are no major roads in our area, most of the roads are thin, and the verges are overgrown with grass and weeds, and these have ruts on either side. As there are not enough roads for the farmer to get to all of his fields without ruining his crops, farmers have built their own tracks out of loose stones and many of these tracks can be found in our area. The tracks have deep ruts on either side due to the heavy weight of the tractors. A large quantity of the roads or tracks in the area are actually footpaths which are widely used by the people most of the time when they do not want to go too far. Generally there are very few well kept roads or tracks.
